pullRequest.title: Add new programming exercise for Swift
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context


We want to have Swift exercises in Artemis, so that it also might be used in the iPraktikum.
Description

This PR adds a template for Swift programming exercises but doesn't contain valid tests for the CI, yet.
A regex pattern for Swift package names was added, so that only unseparated names are allowed, such as "SwiftEx1" and not "Swift_Ex.1"
Steps for Testing


Log in to Artemis
Navigate to Course Administration
Create a new Programming Exercise, select Swift in the dropdown menu and enter a package name
Verify it was successful and start the exercise
Click on open in Online Editor
See a working template for BubbleSort and MergeSort as a Swift code exercise which package's name is the one defined in step 3.
Verify that the ACE module could be loaded and no 404 error appears in the console.

Note: The new programming languages are only supported with Bamboo, so make sure to use TS1 or TS3 when testing.
Test Coverage

The test coverage is almost staying the same, because only existing files were edited, which already have parameterized tests like the Programming Language Enum.
Screenshots

commit.message: reduce to only one bamboo script
add imports for prog languages for ACE editor

nodes.bodyText: Minor nit: I assume this wants the same 4-space indentation like the following TODOs.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,86 @@
+﻿import Foundation
+
+public class Client {
+
+	// TODO: Implement BubbleSort

nodes.bodyText:
This does not look like the correct Swift package pattern, I don't know Swift, but this looks odd to me. I would recommend going through https://docs.swift.org/swift-book/ReferenceManual/LexicalStructure.html#ID413 or similar and exchange the Java keywords by the Swift ones (same on the client side). It is very likely other things need to be adjusted as well. (E.g. if Swift does not support . between the package parts, the first part of the regex needs to be adjusted as well.)
More direct link to identifiers in Swift language reference

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -104,10 +105,18 @@
      * Java package name Regex according to Java 14 JLS (https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se14/html/jls-7.html#jls-7.4.1),
      * with the restriction to a-z,A-Z,_ as "Java letter" and 0-9 as digits due to JavaScript/Browser Unicode character class limitations
      */
-    private final String packageNameRegex = "^(?!.*(?:\\.|^)(?:abstract|continue|for|new|switch|assert|default|if|package|synchronized|boolean|do|goto|private|this|break|double|implements|protected|throw|byte|else|import|public|throws|case|enum|instanceof|return|transient|catch|extends|int|short|try|char|final|interface|static|void|class|finally|long|strictfp|volatile|const|float|native|super|while|_|true|false|null)(?:\\.|$))[A-Z_a-z][0-9A-Z_a-z]*(?:\\.[A-Z_a-z][0-9A-Z_a-z]*)*$";
+    private static final String packageNameRegex = "^(?!.*(?:\\.|^)(?:abstract|continue|for|new|switch|assert|default|if|package|synchronized|boolean|do|goto|private|this|break|double|implements|protected|throw|byte|else|import|public|throws|case|enum|instanceof|return|transient|catch|extends|int|short|try|char|final|interface|static|void|class|finally|long|strictfp|volatile|const|float|native|super|while|_|true|false|null)(?:\\.|$))[A-Z_a-z][0-9A-Z_a-z]*(?:\\.[A-Z_a-z][0-9A-Z_a-z]*)*$";
+
+    /**
+     * Swift package name Regex derived from (https://docs.swift.org/swift-book/ReferenceManual/LexicalStructure.html#ID412),
+     * with the restriction to a-z,A-Z as "Swift letter" and 0-9 as digits where no separators are allowed
+     */
+    private static final String packageNameRegexForSwift = "^(?!.*(?:associatedtype|class|deinit|enum|extension|fileprivate|func|import|init|inout|internal|let|open|operator|private|protocol|public|rethrows|static|struct|subscript|typealias|var|break|case|continue|default|defer|do|else|fallthrough|for|guard|if|in|repeat|return|switch|where|while|as|Any|catch|false|is|nil|super|self|Self|throw|throws|true|try|_)(?:\\.|$))[A-Za-z][0-9A-Za-z]*$";

commit.message:
Update regex for swift

Co-authored-by: Christian Femers <christian.femers@tum.de>
fix swift regex in the client
